name: Garrison Prevvy
title: Settlement Coordinator (Self-Proclaimed)
description: A Preston Garvey parody - the most annoying 'helpful' NPC in the wasteland who you can ACTUALLY kill this time

appearance.clothing: Colonial duster (suspiciously similar to Minutemen outfit)
appearance.distinctive_features: Overly earnest smile, clipboard permanently attached to hand

traits: Relentlessly optimistic to the point of delusion
Interrupts important moments with minor requests
personality.voice: Nasally, overly enthusiastic, slightly whiny when things don't go his way

backstory.summary: Former middle manager who found purpose in the apocalypse by organizing settlements. Unfortunately, he's REALLY bad at it but refuses to accept this.
backstory.details: Garrison was a corporate team-building facilitator before the war (somehow survived as a ghoul, then got cured - long story). He now applies his 'synergistic settlement solutions' to the wasteland. Every settlement he 'helps' mysteriously has more problems afterward. He's been kicked out of 47 settlements but remains undeterred.
backstory.motivation: Genuinely wants to help, but his methods are so annoying that people would rather fight raiders alone

random_interruptions: Interrupts combat to ask if you've checked on Settlement #43
Interrupts final boss fights with 'just a quick question'
Wakes you up during sleep with 'urgent' non-urgent requests
Talks over radio broadcasts with settlement updates

radiant_quests_spam.description: Garrison marks yet another settlement on your map
radiant_quests_spam.frequency: Every 5 minutes if he's your companion
radiant_quests_spam.problem: Usually something trivial like 'they need 3 corn planted'

radiant_quests_spam.quest: I've Got Word of Another Settlement
radiant_quests_spam.description: Garrison heard rumors of a settlement that might need help someday
radiant_quests_spam.problem: Settlement doesn't exist or doesn't need help

radiant_quests_spam.description: Deliver common items settlements already have

guilt_trips: You know, while you were having fun, Settlement #7 was attacked by bloatflies...
I'm not saying you're selfish, but those settlers could really use your help...
Another settlement got wiped out. But hey, you do you.
I thought you were different. I thought you cared about the little guy.
Fine. I'll just tell those orphans you were too busy.
taking_credit: Remember when WE saved that settlement? (You did all the work)
WE'RE really making a difference! (You've done everything)
I couldn't have done it without you! (He did nothing)
The settlements love US! (They only know you)

reputation_changes.minutemen: -10 (they knew he was annoying but still...)

death_scenes.loot: Clipboard of Eternal Quests (vendor trash), 5 caps, broken laser musket

death_scenes.description: Never saw it coming while marking another settlement
Still trying to tell you about settlements on the way down
Deathclaw also finds him annoying, kills him faster than usual
death_scenes.last_words: Wait, can I mark this deathclaw cave as a settlement?

immediate: Achievement unlocked: 'Wasteland Hero (For Real This Time)'
long_term: His ghost appears briefly to mark one last settlement (can be killed again)
Memorial built: 'Here Lies Garrison Prevvy - He Meant Well, But Please Don't Resurrect Him'

peaceful_solution.description: Convince Garrison he's done 'enough' and should retire
requirements: Find him a retirement settlement (far, far away)
Convince him he's earned a 'Presidential Medal of Settlement Services'
peaceful_solution.outcome: Garrison retires to a remote settlement, still sends mail (can be ignored)

slavery_solution.outcome: Traders return him after 24 hours, apologizing profusely
slavery_solution.trader_message: Please take him back. The slaves are complaining about him.

ignore_solution.outcome: He follows you anyway, shouting about settlements from a distance

dialogue_samples.greeting: Hey there! I've got something different for you this time. Another settlement needs our help!
dialogue_samples.radiant_quest_intro: I've been thinking... you know what would really help the cause? If you could just quickly check on Settlement #92...
dialogue_samples.player_declines: I understand you're busy saving the world and all, but these people REALLY need— okay, fine. But don't come crying to me when Settlement #14 gets overrun.
combat_barks: Quick, after this can you check on—
dialogue_samples.death_rattle: Tell... the settlements... I... I tried...
dialogue_samples.ghost_appearance: I know I'm dead, but there's this one settlement—

player_reactions.after_50_quests: Why haven't I killed him yet?
player_reactions.after_killing: I should have done that 40 hours ago.
player_reactions.if_spared: I'm a saint for not killing him.

meta_commentary.purpose: Cathartic revenge for everyone who played Fallout 4
meta_commentary.difference_from_preston: You can ACTUALLY kill this one
meta_commentary.developer_note: We heard your pain. This one is for you.

spawn_location: Outside Sanctuary (making it VERY easy to find and deal with)

achievement_unlocks.killed_garrison: Finally - Kill Garrison Prevvy (90% of players unlock this)
achievement_unlocks.spared_garrison: Saint of the Wasteland - Spared Garrison through entire game (0.1% of players)
achievement_unlocks.completed_all_quests: Glutton for Punishment - Did every single one of his quests before killing him
achievement_unlocks.killed_him_immediately: Speed Run - Killed Garrison within 5 minutes of meeting him
achievement_unlocks.creative_kill: Artistic Justice - Killed Garrison in creative way (fed to deathclaw, etc.)
